bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to P. I. Nixon, October 27, 1947

div1.p: Hench assures Nixon that he is still working on the yellow fever story, but that his rheumatology research brings many responsibilities.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to P. I. Nixon, October 27, 1947
div1.opener:
yellow
fever
October 27, 1947
Dr. P. I. Nixon
1022 Medical Arts Building
San Antonio, Texas
My dear Doctor Nixon:
div1.p:
Thank you for your letter of October 14.
I realize that I have a real responsibility toward
the yellow fever story. The only trouble is that I
have so many other pressing responsibilities in the
field of rheumatology. Nevertheless, I am slowly
keeping at work in odd hours and if my health lasts,
the job will be finished. Thank you again for your
sympathetic interest.
div1.closer: Sincerely, Philip S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
